content:
This chunk introduces a guide on procedurally generating 3D models using Panda's geometry tools, building on prior concepts to explain custom vertex formats, primitives, and scene integration.

Procedurally Generating 3D Models

Building on the fundamental concepts introduced in the last section, the following section explains how to use Panda's basic geometry building blocks to generate your own custom geometry at runtime.

custom-vertex-format predefined-vertex-formats creating-vertex-data creating-primitives putting-geometry-in-scene-graph
